newsitem.title: USA: WIZ repositions, sees year loss.
newsitem.headline: WIZ repositions, sees year loss.

text.p: Wiz Technology Inc said Monday it plans to reposition its business, resulting in about a $3 million writeoff in the fourth quarter and an estimated loss of more than $2.5 million for the year.
WIZ said the move is meant to help the transition of its core business to Intranet sales, away from publishing and marketing budget software.
In announcing the change, the company said it does not expect to meet an extended November 13 deadline for filing its annual report.
As a result, the company said, trading of its stocks will likely be halted November 14. WIZ said it plans to file its annual report within seven to 10 days after that date.

WIZ said the estimated $3 million in asset write-offs include charges to software development, inventory, accounts receivable and fixed assets. The losses are expected on revenues of between $7 to $8 million, the company said.

Despite the loss, the company is in "sound financial condition" and has enough capital and liquidity to meet the ongoing operations for the foreseeable future, said Chief Financial Officer Richard Nance, who was appointed in September.
The company said it believes focusing its business on the sale of Intranet systems will be commercially successful.
"The company believes revenues generated from this concept will be realized in the first half of fiscal 1997," Nance said, but he added that "no assurances can be provided at this time."
